WRITING.TEXT: nail polish has never helped. My nail biting is so unconscious now, i honestly have no freakin clue when im doing it. My fiance calls me out when he catches me doing it, but if he's not around, i will mindlessly bite my nails as im watching a movie, working, etc etc. It's not even a nervous tick thing its like a...all the time thing!!! Ill bite right through that polish without a care in the world haha. But maybe getting regular manicures might help.

thats smart actually. yeah im terrible at them, even if i spend money on manicures ill still bite. i was thinking gel nails, but honestly i dont know much about gel vs acrylic so i dont know what to do!
oh that is LOVELY! congrats!

WRITING.TITLE: Nail Biters, What Did You Do/Are You Planning To Do for Your Wedding Day?
WRITING.TEXT: I've been a nail biter for yeaars. (about 24, to be exact). So, my nails are always squat and to the tip of the skin, never long. They look kind of crappy. Did you guys do fake nails? Did they stay on? It feels almost weird to me to do because... no one has ever seen me with nails. But, i dont want my hands to look meh in photos. So did you guys do anything, or plan on doing anything? or did you say F it and rock your bitten nails as always?
I have been focusing on macros, and it hasnt done anything for me alone. So im counting both.
His face, I can't get over it! so cute!

I am in the literal same boat. Started heavy lifting mid November. 5'2, 115 at start. about 118 now. I feel much stronger, for sure,but i don't see anything, other than bigger thighs. (bigger...but not necessarily cut). I think my biggest issue is that i still like my beers (empty carbs/calories) and fiance likes to out to eat once a week (and HE's the one who got me into lifting! somehow he looks better than me despite def having a worse overall diet haha). While i do stick to the right amount of calories i think HOW im getting my calories can definitely improve, so thats where im working.
They are Clarks from summer 2015. Just worked out i had them already!

You know, it just drizzled here and there but overall it definitely held off! I had a really cute umbrella just in case we needed to shoot with it but we lucked out. The dress is from rent the runway! [here it is](https://www.renttherunway.com/shop/designers/ml_monique_lhuillier/blushing_envy_dress)

I agree with you, its too much. The lashes are definitely too long, or at least they look like they just have clumpy mascara. if it were smoother it wouldnt be so bad. But yeah, less mascara, and light shadow and i think the overall look would be much better!

Can't wait to get the rest later this week! We had a blast even though it ended up being much colder than we wouldve liked, we were FROZEN by the end. But the wind off the water worked for this shot, thankfully!

WRITING.TITLE: The First Image of my Engagement Shoot from Yesterday!

WRITING.TEXT: Just commenting to say date twin!
it looks fantastic, not too tight at all. Does it feel comfortable? As long as you feel good in it, and can move, i say go for it!
The batman groom topper! I love it
Who did you go to? I live in nyc, curious!
I have never done well with kelly and katie shoes. as cute as they are, they ALWAYS hurt!
Id say get them on it. I ordered mine from DB for my friends wedding last year, in early January. Her wedding was May 21st. I got it 2 weeks before the wedding and had to run to get it hemmed!
I've been eyeing those betsey johnsons! how comfy are they? I am a person who can go a few hours in 4 inch heels, so under that i think i could do all night for my dress. how high are they?
holy crap so is yours! Was looking at similar in westchester but obviously we booked something very different ha. Best of luck in planning :)
In Manhattan at the Harold Pratt House. You?
Date twins! Also STATE twins! what are the chances ;)
Totally up to you. My best friend did not do them, but im doing that because i want them for the website and save the dates. But, im also being given them as a gift from a photographer friend.
I really like #4, and im surprised because i normally HATE dresses with layered skirts like that. But its cute!

I have IBS, so you know when people run a long distance run and then gotta poop? Thats me...after a mile. Sometimes there's not much i can do but stop and take care of it. Some days i have to wait hours until i feel better to go to the gym. And other days... i just cant make it to the gym because i cant seem to get off to toilet :-\ Sorry if thats TMI but honestly, its my day to day life so i dont really see it as TMI anymore ha. I do what i can to work around it, ido what i can to make up for lost days, but i try my damndest not to beat myself up for missing a day, or for maybe not being able to work out as hard because my stomach is in pain, etc.

my fiance is the same but thats why i give him more tactical things to do. Less opinion oriented, more "can you call this potential vendor? can you get me addresses? can you order this thing?" that might be the way to approach him if he doesnt want to make decisions.
thats a really good point i totally understand!

Im having the OPPOSITE problem. I am having a kids allowed wedding because I have 8 cousins on my moms side, ages 6 to 14 (moms brothers had kids MUCH later than she did, as I am 30!). I love them all dearly, I am close to them all, and I want them there! But ive had a couple of people give me the whole "oh, theres gonna be...kids?" reaction like as if im sullying my wedding with them. IT's so funny how no matter what you do, there's always something someone has issues with!

Yup we are also using ours for our save the dates, which I need to go out like...ASAP! So we only just booked a photographer a couple of weeks ago (We got engaged a month ago, short engagement!) but a friend of mine who is a photographer wanted to do our engagement shoot as a gift for us (i didnt want him to do the actual wedding because i want him there as a guest, not working!). So as you can imagine, setting it up was a lot easier instead of having to book through our photographer. Plus, that 2 hours that our photog would have used to the shoot is now going to the wedding so we have more hours of shooting the day of the event, so it's a win/win!

oh man picking the dress is HUGE! I havent done so yet, i am going for round two not this weekend but next, in which im retrying on one i loved but also some other stuff. I feeel like ill make a decision by then because im not one to drag things out but we'll see. But this week, i met with a florist who is whipping up a proposal for me for next week! We also set up an appointment with a caterer for 2 weeks from now. And once the last couple of addresses roll in, i will be order invitations. Oh, and engagement shoot is tomorrow! lots of wins!
well you look lovely in a lot of these nopes!
yeah i can see that not really fitting a brunch wedding. lovely though!
whoa that black and white one isnt really my style but i can appreciate how beautiful it is!
Aaah date twins! They look fantastic!
[Here's one of mine to start!](http://imgur.com/a/164s5)

WRITING.TITLE: Show me the dresses you said "No" to!
WRITING.TEXT: I'm really curious about the dresses people said no to, i think it'd be kind of fun if you have photos of dresses where you were just like...nope. Not the one!
this is going to sound so weird and creepy but...your butt looks amazing in this! haha i love the detail of it. lovely!
wooo date twins! :)

WRITING.TITLE: [For Hire] Social Media Consultant Engagement Manager
WRITING.TEXT: I have 7+ years of experience as a social media engagement manager and consultant. I live in NYC and can work locally or remotely. I have worked with major brands in the past like bareMinerals, Tresemme, Klondike, Netflix and more. I can act as a consultant and help with overall strategy, audience research and competitor research, or I can even work more directly as a manager of your social pages. I have experience in analytics, influencer programs, insights reports etc. I start at $25 an hour or can work on a flat fee depending on the project. Serious inquiries only. DM me for more info.
I meaaaan their stuff is so cute and especially comfy, so i definitely encourage the habit ;)
Not a blog, but a podcast. Bridechilla is literally the funniest, most down to earth wedding advice I've ever heard. I highly recommend it!
aaah it looks lovely! I wish i had that talent!
It's surprisingly pretty comfy too! i wasnt sure how id feel in it but it's really nice!
found them! no longer available on U.S. clarks site though it seems, they were summer 2015. http://sepatuclarks.com/product/tan-combi-2/
They are clarks! I just went on a hunt for them online but i bought then like a year and a half ago so i don't remember the name or anything

Its great! Ive used it for 2 black tie weddings before and this is the first time with a more casual dress. Take advantage of the free extra size they send aa an option, and pro tip: if you rent on a thursday for 4 days, for example, and your return date is sunday, they actually give you one more day to return since they know sunday is a no mail day!
Thank you! I definitely will!
#HeadingtotheChappell ?
it's hard to see but there's a pink lining underneath. Engagement shoot is this Saturday! So excited!

WRITING.TITLE: Engagement shoot dress came in from Rent The Runway!

WRITING.TEXT: I honestly dont care much about flowers. I want them, sure, but i dont care what they look like all that much, as long as they are in theme colors. I thought that was "weird" too...but then i realized F it. It's just not something icare to waste time thinking on. I talked to a florist today, i told her im open to ideas, here's all the logistical things i need... and honestly id be happy with anything. slap a bouquet in my hands and im good to go!

thats what i did, but even that hadnt worked. Then again, i dont know if i used the particular driver that was recommended above. when the new laptop comes in tomorrow, ill do it (since i already sent back the old not thinking it was going to be a widespread issue!).
oh maaaaan if this works im going to kiss my computer screen in hopes it reaches your cheeks.

WRITING.TITLE: Bought New Laptop, Windows 10 update broke Trackpad Driver
WRITING.TEXT: So frustrated. Just bought a new Asus laptop for freelance work; my current desktop I built and has 8.1 so im used to that. This new laptop obviously comes with 10. It goes through the set up, my mouse works fine, then it does a large update that kills the trackpad. Turns out it's a driver issue; tried updating driver, doesnt fix. Tried troubleshoot, and all that did then was make a once useable USB mouse unusable too! Tried completely reinstalling windows 10 since it was a brand new laptop, that didn't work either. Can't even see the pointer of the mouse let alone use it. So i thought maybe it was a fluke with my hardware and am doing an exchange with Amazon and sure enough, past 2-3 days, reviews have cropped up saying they are all having the same issue! The laptop is a ASUS F556UA-AB54. Here's the [amazon link](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01M08DL26/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8 psc=1) so you can see the reviews having the same issue. I'm wondering if I'm just fucked until Microsoft fixes this issue, or if i should try to start up my new laptop without an update (can I even do that?) or just... I don't know. Exchange again for a total different laptop. First experience ever with Windows 10 and I'm already pissed!
Mine are also this weekend and im right there with you!

Two, and we booked the first one we visited! We fell in love immediately but gave a second venue a chance since we had it set up to see it already. But nope, we slept on it one night and were like...yeah ok let's just book it!
I like, giggled when i saw this in a positively giddy way. its AMAZING.

He makes me laugh, no matter what. He's absolutely absurd sometimes, and even if I peg it as "annoying", eventually it just makes me giggle. He's supportive of all my endeavors. I just quit my full time job to go freelance which is terrifying! But he supported it 100%. And then asked me to marry him after the fact! ha! So i guess he really is OK with it ;) he has shown me commitment to our relationship even early on by squashing some sort of destructive habits because he wanted US more than he wanted to continue said habits, and that meant a ton to me. He's really good with kids. He's incredibly intelligent, especially when it comes to politics, world news and history, in a way im just not. It used to intimidate me but now I just appreciate it a ton and learn from him. He's crazy outgoing. We compliment each other well in that he's a procrastinator and has the worst memory ever, and I'm an OCD do-er and remember EVERYTHING. I'm his walking calendar/scheduler that keeps him together, but he reminds me when it's ok to throw caution to the wind and be spontaneous.

We are not doing a program at all, but we're handing out wedding achievement checklists. We're gamers and want to nod to this, so people will get a list of things to do at the wedding for the night! I love this idea for the program, though. Hilarious! You can really make this your own.

I went to a wedding where the officiant made the announcement. He said something to the effect of " XX and XX ask that you put your phones away for the ceremony and be in the present moment. We have a wonderful photographer who will capture the moment and those photos we will share with you, but we'd love if you could focus on the here and now." it was really nicely done and everyone listened!

it really IS motivating just knocking everything out! We booked our venue a week and a half after we got engaged, and that was with zero knowledge of where we wanted to get married prior! Im just a crazy organized person haha
you look like a MODEL! amazing!

9 months, from the day we were engaged to the day of the wedding exactly (we're at the 8 month mark now!). Everyone has been giving us crap for the short engagement and made me do a double take at first. And then i realized none of their opinions matter! haha we're taking planning in stride and so far it's been a ton of fun!

I am going through the same thing. My mom passed away 10 years ago, when I was 20. I went wedding dress shopping with my FMIL, because she's only ever had sons, and im lucky to really get along with her. But i am going for round 2 of shopping with my MOH and another bridesmaid in 2 weeks; I'd rather have SOMEONE with me instead of do it alone. As for the actual wedding, we are having a memorial table for a few people, including her. I will also be dancing with my brother to "California Dreamin" in honor of her, as The Mamas and The Papas were a huge favorite of hers, we used to listen to that album on vinyl growing up. Unsure on anything else, possibly a charm with her photo on my bouquet. It is really tough; Im right there with you. Its such a bittersweet thing.
Zola for actual items, HoneyFund for the honeymoon. And that's it!

Yuuup. We had a little engagement celebration shindig last night at a bar, nothing formal. But we had such an outpouring of love from our friends, and then this morning i was like...man. I'm happy. Really happy!
WOW. it looks fantastic on you.
Our venue contract is signed, as is our photographer contract! I also have meetings with a dj, our officiant and a florist in the coming 3 weeks! Every major vendor step us a win!

Mine also told me to mail my invites the month before.... id rather mail then out 6-8 weeks before, thank you very much. Im taking it with a grain of salt; checking things off but not necessarily going by their actual time line.

My dad and I have always had a light hearted, fun relationship... never a sappy "daddys girl" sort of one. So a slow dance to some sappy song does NOT feel like us. Instead, I want to learn how to dance the hustle (which he danced with my mom a lot back in the day, she passed 10 years ago). So, i want our dance together to be to Born To Be Alive, which was a song i have fond memories of us singing in the car together when i was little. Disco all the way! Im not telling anyone save for a couple of close friends.

That's absurd. you have this once in a lifetime event coming up... and SHE wants YOU to "Work with me here"?!?! No! she should be working with YOU here!
I do agree, talk it out with your dad. tell him what you said and why you said it (Because you were frustrated) and that it wasn't truly you uninviting her, but you were frustrated that she wasnt understanding that you couldn't break your plans for her.
Your photographer is amazing. And I won't lie, I swooned over that cat (im a big cat person). I'd love to have an extra furry guest! ;)
We are using Ein Photography. Tim's work is just beautiful!
I just moved from salaried to full time freelance... and as my own boss, I'm giving myself 2 days before and 1 weekday after the wedding off ;)
same here! I am spelling names out, even if i called them by a shorter version, but definitely no honorifics. Seriously, i can't think about it either!

That is intense. Not just one issue, but multiple. It sounds VERY vindictive and intentional, not like an "oops we insulted them but didn't mean to" situation. I would be livid, especially because your parents took it with such grace and had to do just that... take it! I know FH spoke to them but since they ARE going to be your in-laws, i think you should talk to them as well.
Yup, the quotes given include eveeerything, and nicely broke down each and every piece... including tax and gratuity!
IT. HAS. POCKETS?! There is nothing better to me than a dress with pockets!

To my FH, it's just paper. I mean, i totally get it. Im not obsessing either and we picked our design pretty quickly, but still was it hard to get ANY opinion out of him! The venue is just super unique and has some great history. It's called the Pratt House, in NYC, if you want to take a look!

We saw our venue for a second time last weekend with his parents, who also loved it. He got home and couldn't stop talking about how excited he was about it! Like literally would interrupt totally unrelated convos to tell me haha. Mind you, he's really not cared about much...invitations? whatever. Colors? pick what you want. Flowers? what are those. But man, is he ever excited about the venue!
Your venue reminds me a lot of my own. Beautiful! Your shoes are awesome as well!

Wow then i guess we're doing ok! For us the 20k includes cocktail hour, dinner, staff, rentals, and bar (though my fiance's dad has a wine store, so he is providing wine champagne and the vendor would provide liquor, mixers, beer which cut costs for us there). No wedding cake included, and dinner is 2 courses so if we'd want to do anything else obviously thatd be more.

WRITING.TITLE: Manhattan Brides (or Grooms).. Real Talk, How Much Did Catering Cost?
WRITING.TEXT:
To all those who got married in Manhattan, or NYC area in general, how much did catering cost? I am a little shocked at some of the prices im being given (like, 20k after tax and all is said and done, for 120 people) but a friend of mine got married at the W in union square last year and was like "yup, cost us about 23-25k, you're on par for manhattan."
Mind you, my venue does not provide their own catering, they are just literally an event space, so this is all coming from outside vendors.
Is this insane, or is this just typical for manhattan and it is what it is?
We just started reaching out to book blocks, our wedding is in 8 months in the Upper East Side. Crossing my fingers we don't run into issues!
We are doing it. Got engaged 3 weeks ago, getting married in just over 8 months. If you are an organized person, it can be done. Promise!
Personally, the left looks lovely on you!
The shadow and the lip don't go well together at all, and the shadow is far too dark (and really weirdly done and not blended well). Agreed also on your foundation being a shade too dark.
haha EXACTLY! I was like...wait...how...

WRITING.TITLE: Wear Your Chosen Undergarments to Wedding Dress Shopping... But How Can I Know What Those Will Be?!
WRITING.TEXT: I see all of this advice everywhere thats like, make sure you wear the undergarments you are going to wear at your wedding when you go dress shopping (ie spanx etc). Like... i have no idea what im GOING to need to wear until i pick a dress style! I also literally own one pair of spanx shorts... the end. I feel like if i just wear a strapless bra and panties im doing something wrong... did you guys bring like, all the undergarments you'd expect to wear? Did it not matter? I understand it for actual fitting appointments... but why do i need it for just finding the dress? I am going Saturday and feel like im going to be underprepared, or is the advice just nonsense?

My fiance comes from a family of a good deal of wealth, and so the parents have had prenup agreements already figure out for him and his two brothers. This was something I knew years ago and i respect. I'm not going to argue against it and it isn't keeping us from getting married! I understand where they are coming from.

We are in a similar boat, engaged 3 weeks ago, getting married this fall. We are moving quickly on the major vendor things (have our venue, date, photographer, and officiant already locked down! caterers next!) because you really do need to jump on it if you are doing only a 9-10 month engagement. Even if you are doing winter 2018, thats still less than a year out. Id get ahead on anything you can thats major, so that you can relax a little later on and focus on the smaller details!
right? Thats what i was thinking. But her and one other person were really against it :-/ i guess in the end im the one putting it on stationary, i should just choose ha

Im in the opposite boat. We got engaged 2/18, we are getting married 11/18. And im getting the "oh my god you are getting married this YEAR? Good luck!" "You're never going to be able to get everything together!" "Oh wow, thats so FAST." Like ugh, this is MY wedding, not yours, and i dont go by anyone else's timeline! So i say to you if you want to get things done early, get em done early! Screw everyone's thoughts on "when" things should happen!

I had my first one last night! I think we're all on some weird wave length. Mine was i was going to try on dresses (i am this weekend for real) and the people who were supposed to come bailed on me. And I had to go by myself and was so hurt that everyone just made excuses and couldn't come.

Ok so our last names are a struggle either way! His is Menchaca mine is Melgarejo. I am taking his name. Right now we are leaning towards #MarryingMenchaca but he and i are silly people with a sense of humor and prefer something funny. First names are Peter and Christine. I tried #HePeterRingOnIt but my MOH said it sounds like "hepeedaringonit" soo i guess that one is out. We are also cool with initials being used. Thoughts?! Im struggling and i...gasp... work in social media. Im so embarrassed haha
Great minds!

We definitely want cocktails, and we're picking them based on some of our own fav drinks. Mine will be a mojito, his will be a moscow mule. We even have great names for them that play off our last names ;)
I just ordered swatches in two potential colors so im excited to see how it works! I offered the ladies to pay for their $10 fees for trying on samples. I'm excited to try them out!
that's really good to know!
"You can mail me at 123 Yemen Road, Yemen" cracked me up. Love it!

WRITING.TITLE: Azazie Experiences?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi all, I've been looking into Azazie for my bridesmaids' dresses. I only have 3 (and 2 bridesmen!), one being the MOH. I love the idea of choosing the color and then having them choose their own floor length style. The prices seem to good to be true; has anyone used them? Hows the quality? Is it a slow turn around time? Any customer service issues? Just trying to figure it all out before i send them to this site!

We're doing one. Our venue is just blocks from Central Park so we'll be doing it there, then inviting the wedding party to take some photos so we can get that all done pre-ceremony! I also want to feel less nervous all around for the ceremony. i dont believe in the tradition (or the "bad luck" that comes with it!).

My birthday is the 19th! We're making sure the wedding runs into midnight just for this ;)
Just had to say... DATE TWINS! :)
I feel your loss and I'm sorry for it; i lost my mom 10 years ago and it still hurts, especially planning my wedding. I wish you all the strength and love in your future.

As a NYC bride, love to hear all this! Green Building is awesome, had a work holiday party there 2 years ago. What were your thoughts on Paisley Bridal? I live in Queens and while Im booked to check out two places in the city, i came across it and was considering it.
As someone who works in social media, that is literally against everything I would ever tell a client to do. Such poor taste and sneaky.

WRITING.TITLE: How I Quit My Full Time Job to go Freelance!

WRITING.TEXT: Fianc and i are atheist so no real program needed!
I love them SO SO MUCH. I am a huge zelda fan, it was the first video game I ever played at 4 years old. And im a big gamer/nerd. Amazing!
Programs. no one needs a program. No one keeps the program. waste of $$. No videographer; video just gets dated so fast.
Angelique Bridal and then BHLDN on the UES. RK Bridal is def on my list though if neither of these work out!
